text.section: Deadline for filing. Proof of all claims must be filed with the court in the form required by KRS 304.33-370 on or before the last day for filing specified in the notice required under KRS 304.33-250, except that proof of preferred ownership claims and proprietary claims under subsections (9) and (10) of KRS 304.33-430, need not be filed at all, and proof of claims for unearned premiums and claims for cash surrender values or other investment values in life insurance and annuities need not be filed unless the liquidator expressly so requires.

Unexcused late filings. The liquidator may consider any claim filed late which is not covered by subsection (2) of this section, and permit it to receive dividends, other than the first dividend, which are subsequently declared on any claims of the same or lower priority if the payment does not prejudice the orderly administration of the liquidation. The late-filing claimant shall receive, at each distribution, the same percentage of the amount allowed on his claim as is then being paid to other claimants of the same priority plus the same percentage of the amount allowed on his claim as is then being paid to claimants of any lower priority. This shall continue until his claim has been paid in full.

law.history: Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 255, sec. 5, effective July 14, 2000. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 33, sec. 36, effective June 18, 1970.
